caption: Beautiful church and Jaw dropping views! Climbing stairs was a mission! Warm inside church with spectacular designs and history. I got here early when I left was super crowded. It's cold on top in Winter! Church was heated.

I visited here during Christmas üéÑ at night. This is truly amazing üëè. I liked the ambience and decorations. This is the last scene in John Wick 4 movie. Instead of steps i will recommend to take elevator for 2 euro. There are lot of steps and elevator is a better option. Inside is truly amazing and spiritual ‚ú®Ô∏è üôè

Absolute must visit while visiting Paris. You can take the Polybahn or Stairs to reach the top. I'd recommend taking a stroll right behind the Basilica to check out the restaurants they have in the market. You can sit outside and do people watching while sipping on coffee or cocktail with some nice food. Plenty of street artists would be ready to give you a Sketch of yours if you want one. View from the top is amazing.

This is a scared and beautiful place that's an architectural marvel. The church is beautiful inside out and located on top of a hill with amazing Paris views. It's a must visit if you are in the town.

A must see. This church has extremely beautiful architecture followed by a breathtaking ambiance inside.  It continues the same tradition of having centuries of history, artifacts, and statues as the other magnificent churches and cathedrals I‚Äôve visited in Paris.  This time there was an actual service happening during my visit.  It was amazing to see that this amazing venue is still active and not just a tourist attraction.

Stunning, peaceful, tranquil, wonderful. If you can handle the steps, paying to climb to the top is highly recommended as the view is unbeatable and seeing in the towers and on the roof is a rare experience. Be warned, there's 300 steps to climb though for that view. Even if you don't do that option, highly worth visiting this stunning and peaceful church.

The Basilique du Sacre-Coeur (Basilica of the Sacred Heart) on Monmartre Hill in Paris is an absolutely stunning building, set in the artistic heart of Paris with stunning views of the city of lights. This Catholic cathedral began construction in 1875 and was completed almost forty years later.  It is a beautiful basilica inside and out, with two mounted knight statues flanking it on the roof. These impressive statues represent French saints Joan of Arc and King Louis IX. Watch for intricate gargoyles decorating the outside of the building as well, on all sides.  Inside the basilica,columns, vaulted ceilings and domes give it height and light inside. Murals decorate the inside of the dome and statues of angels with spears guard the dome. Stained glass windows are sprinkled throughout. Look for the excellent scale model that can be found of the Basilique du Sacre-Coeur with its working lights and its location on the street of the surrounding area of Montmartre Hill.  This is the second most visited tourist attraction in Paris and it is justified. Its location on the hill is an excellent spot for views of the city. The old artist colony on Montmarte hill is also worth checking out, but beware of pickpockets disguised as artists wanting to draw your portrait with dirty sketch pads. There were many of them while we were there and I saw them stealing wallets myself.

Must visit place in Paris .a peaceful place to visit for the tourist.. You need to climb more than 100 steps to reach the church and there is a paid rob car option  available to reach the church Beware of road side sellers and robbers specially the dark ones üòâ if they see you as tourist they will come on you and forcefully ask you for some euro. So take some local help. There is a shopping street below that.. You can buy souvenirs and other needed items You can see the full view of Paris from the top

This is the place to get the panoramic view of Paris. You can climb up to the top which is 284 steps and it's amazing. The entrance for climbing the steps is just after the security check to the left. The steps are very steep and it's difficult for children and old people.  This is the most memorable place in our Paris visit. You can view all 360 degree angles of Paris and it's really breathtaking

Beautiful Catholic Church located on top of Montmartre. This is the second most popular tourist spot in Paris only after Eiffel Tower, speaks for itself.  You don‚Äôt have to buy a ticket, it is free entry into the church.

Sitting on the highest point in Paris, (Butte Montmartre) really does offer a beautiful view of the city. The beautiful white domes and Romanesque- Byzantine style is truly marvellous. However, do be careful of scammers trying to put bracelets on your arm at the bottom of the stairs.

A Beautiful building and great panoramic views of Paris Definitely a must-do in Paris fantastic location and a truly iconic Parisian building. Its easy to get to from the metro and you can use the funicular railway if you don't want to walk the steps. Only downside plenty of hawkers there and some are very pushy. so many tourists and pilgrims stay here. An uphill climb entails but a funicular ride saves the day. People peddling souvenirs, street artist showing their talent and a huge crowd enjoying the scenery and admiring the views and the beautiful basilica. Inside the church however, it must be quiet with lots of the visitors praying. It is open to the public  and meditation are continuous.

Beautiful, from the outside as that is as far as we got. We first tried to wait in line for the Opera house but didn't make it in time. So we walked here. My husband & son joked with me that I found the only hill in Paris.....as I enjoyed our walk from one to the other. It was our last full day in Paris, along with it being my 45th birthday. I just enjoyed walking everywhere. We even walked back all the way to the Saint Germain area.  We were there on a Sunday, and there were a lot of others that had the same thoughts as us. We saw a long line and opted to leave.

The Basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur de Montmartre is an absolute must-visit when in Paris! The stunning white domes of the basilica are iconic, and the panoramic views of the city from the top are breathtaking. Whether you're inside admiring the beautiful mosaics and serene atmosphere or outside soaking in the vibrant energy of Montmartre, this place is magical. The climb up the hill is worth every step, but there‚Äôs also a funicular for those who prefer an easier route. The surrounding area is full of charm, with artists painting in the square and cozy caf√©s nearby. A truly unforgettable experience that captures the heart and soul of Paris. Highly recommend!

Nice, short and free visit to this Basilique, with great views of the city. Arrive early in the morning before the crowds gather in!!! We also climbed up the dome: that's ‚Ç¨8 per person, but you get such a gorgeous 360¬∞ view up there!!!! Beware that there is no elevator, so you should have no mobility issues if you are planning to give it a try!!

Amazing views from the Basilique day Sacre-Coeur de Montmare . There are two flights of steps to get to the cathedral the was I went. So many people were out today enjoying the sun and local musicians were on the stairs singing. The Basilique was large with Roman inspired domes and stained glass windows. There were several altars with St. Michael, Virgin Mary and Jesus and more. A que was set up for tourists to view and admire. It is recommended to be silent while entering as religious Catholics were praying. There is no entry fee required for the church . As a catholic, I enjoyed the serenity and ambiance of this church. I would highly recommend and light a candle or pray üôè

Just take photos in front of is a great experience with stunning views from the front. However, be prepared for a challenging climb up the stairs, as it can be quite exhausting. Additionally, the nearby restrooms only accept cash, so it‚Äôs a good idea to carry some with you. Overall, the visit is worth it for the beautiful photo opportunities and the impressive architecture.
Absolutely stunning structure, both inside and out. The queues are worth the wait, even in the rain. It is a working institution but does allow tourists to enter moving quietly around the services.
Quite an incredible cathedral on top of a hill overlooking the city of Paris. The mont marte neighborhood itself is very lovely and you can spend a good amount of time walking along the neighborhood

The basilica is a peaceful place and an iconic building in the city of Paris. Montmarte can be spotted in the distance from various places in Paris. It is a fairly modern build in terms of basilicas (early 1900‚Äôs) but yet charming. The landscape to the gardens are well maintained. Walk to the top can be steep. Anyone with mobility issues can use the ‚Äúpaid‚Äù for funicular which is to the side of the basilica. The closest underground station is Anviers. Transportation is well connected. It is free to enter the main church and costs ‚Ç¨8 as November 2024 to access the crypt and the top. The inside of the basilica is fairly average compared with other Parisian churches. Queues can be long so if you are pressed for time you may wish to skip going in. The basilica and the surrounding grounds can at times be extremely crowded as it is a popular attraction.

This church is quite stunning, and the grounds of the church are also impressive. The views are almost in paralleled in the city.  Do expect crowds !  Even in the winter time the crowds are big and the line to get into the church are long. But still, it is worth the visit.
Beautiful view of Paris! The town is a must go as well. There is a lift to the top that uses the same metro card if climbing up is too rough.

Must visit just for the view. Lots of little tourist shops and restaurants on the way there. Very crowded. You can enter the church and get a better view from the tower. If you do not want walk up the hill, there is little tram that can take you up.

This is one of the most beautiful Basilicas we have visited in Europe üòç  For the religious Catholic visitors, this sacred temple will be a very moving and mystical experience. Do not miss the opportunity to live it üôè  In the other hand, for non-religious visitors, this is a beautiful Basilica, with a remarcable architecture and an amazing view of Paris from one of the heights points of the city ‚ù§Ô∏è  100% recommended üëç

Stunning views and breathtaking architecture! Sacr√©-C≈ìur is a must-visit in Paris, offering a peaceful atmosphere and some of the best panoramic views of the city. Truly unforgettable! Recommended to visit early in the morning when it is less crowded.

The place itself was great! But, on the pickpocket side, here are a couple scams a saw that might be good to look out for:  THREE CUPS, ONE BALL: this is a very common scam where some guy will have a ball under three metal cups, with a bunch of people who seem to be the public, but are actually part of the scam. They just kinda stand around until a tourist comes where they try and pressure you into playing, when you refuse, a random person(who‚Äôs secretly in on the trick) pays up, and wins. This then lures the tourist into playing, where they swiftly take the ball in a sleek hand movement, making the game impossible to win. If you can just walk right past and ignore.  NECKLACE/BRACELET: this one has people selling necklaces/bracelets, where they will try and force them onto you, and if they succeed in doing so they will threaten to call the cops should you not pay and say you will be arrested if you don‚Äôt pay quickly. Just back away and try tell them you have no money, make sure they do not get the bracelet on you, or they will take a photo as ‚Äúproof‚Äù you stole it.

This place is an amazing spot to sit and pray if it‚Äôs your thing. You can visit this basilica after 6:30 AM. However, this is an operational church please respect it by dressing appropriately. Though im not Christian, I respect their belief and culture. This has some cool ceiling painting and many interesting statues of various saints. The dome is open after 10:30 onwards for public but please check the timings and visiting hours on the official website before visiting. There js no entry fee to this place.
Probably the most peaceful place in Paris. I love how solemn the church is. After Notre Dame reopened, it is much less crowded. Beautiful artworks and shrines. Security is a breeze.

The Sacr√©-C≈ìur Basilica, also known as the Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Paris, was completed in 1914 and consecrated in 1919. It was built as a symbol of hope and faith following the Franco-Prussian War and the Paris Commune, intended to serve as a spiritual beacon for the city.  Visitors can climb the 300 steps to the top of the dome for a breathtaking panoramic view of Paris. This vantage point is one of the highest in the city, offering a spectacular 360-degree view.  Despite being a major tourist attraction, the basilica maintains a serene and spiritual atmosphere. The peaceful environment, especially during early mornings or late evenings, offers a reprieve from the bustling city below.  Entry Fee: Entry to the basilica is free, but there is a small fee to access the dome and the crypt.  Photography: Photography is allowed inside the basilica, but flash and tripods are prohibited to maintain a respectful environment.  The Sacr√©-C≈ìur Basilica is not only an architectural gem but also a spiritual haven that offers some of the best views of Paris.

Nice, short and free visit to this Basilique, with great views of the city. There was huge crowd when I visited. If you want to climb up to the top of dome to get panaromic view of city, its chargeable at ‚Ç¨8 per person. There is no elevator, so you should have no mobility issues if you are planning to give it a try!!
Great visit, obviously a beautiful building! Great views from the dome as well. It's free entry too except for the dome.

The Basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur de Montmartre is an absolute masterpiece! Perched atop Montmartre Hill, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of Paris that are truly unforgettable. The stunning white domes and intricate architecture are awe-inspiring, and the serene interior provides a peaceful escape from the bustling city. The atmosphere is both spiritual and welcoming, with beautiful mosaics that capture your imagination. The climb to the dome is worth every step for the incredible vistas. Whether you're a history lover, a spiritual seeker, or simply exploring Paris, this basilica is a must-visit destination. Highly recommended!

Quite a bit of walking steep climbing one has to (if the funicular is not operational) to reach this highest point in Paris. But the hardwork is totally worth it. Entrance to the basilica is free however they charge you to get to the top of the dome. IMO, this is one of top 5 places to visit when in Paris. Go early in the morning around 7:30-8 am of you want to avoid the crazy, irritating crowds that throng the place later.

The Basilique du Sacr√©-C≈ìur is an absolutely stunning landmark in Paris! Perched atop Montmartre, the views from the basilica are breathtaking, offering a panoramic glimpse of the city. The architecture is awe-inspiring, and the serene atmosphere inside provides a perfect moment for reflection. Whether you're admiring the intricate details of the dome or enjoying the lively surroundings of Montmartre, this is a must-visit spot. Highly recommend experiencing it both during the day and at sunset!

A beautiful basilica in the north of Paris, set on a quaint hill in a stunning area. The building has an interesting history for the catholic heritage of Paris, and is incredible both inside and out. There is also a great view of Paris from the top of the hill, just in front of the basilica.

Sacr√©-C≈ìur has been on my list to visit for some time and I am so happy to finally visit. The atmosphere both inside and out was fantastic. The clergy were providing blessings and the church staff were walking around providing a piece of paper to write a prayer to submit at the nativity scene. They also handed out a small candle to light on Christmas Day. In the late afternoon they had a choir (including a priest) singing Christmas carols outside on the front steps. It was very special experience and I am happy I was able to visit.
Awe inspiring building with such a rich history.  A must visit.  The views from the hill are incredible, and the church building inside is breathtaking.

The Basilica of Sacr√©-C≈ìur, perched atop the highest point in the city on Montmartre Hill, is a stunning architectural masterpiece that attracts visitors from around the world. Its striking white dome and intricate mosaics are not only visually impressive but also make it one of the most recognizable landmarks in Paris.  Upon entering the basilica, visitors are greeted by an awe-inspiring interior featuring one of the world‚Äôs largest mosaics, ‚ÄúChrist in Glory,‚Äù which adds to the spiritual ambiance of the space. The basilica is a place of worship and reflection, inviting guests to pause and appreciate its serene atmosphere.  The panoramic views from the steps of Sacr√©-C≈ìur are simply breathtaking, offering a sweeping vista of the Paris skyline. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for photography, especially during sunset when the city is bathed in golden light.  While the basilica can get crowded, especially during peak tourist seasons, its beauty and tranquility make the visit worthwhile. Whether you‚Äôre exploring the art and history, enjoying the views, or attending a mass, the Basilica of Sacr√©-C≈ìur is an unforgettable experience that captures the essence of Parisian charm.
